text: <@U7THT3TM3>, interested in your thoughts on <https://github.com/JuliaData/StructTypes.jl/pull/42> if you have a minute to review. I think it’s a common enough pattern that a few of us have just done in our own code (i.e. just calling `obj = JSON3.read(source); x = StructTypes.constructfrom(T, obj)`), that it would be nice to just support natively. Now you lower your own type when serializing (which is also familiar for regular JSON.jl users), and follow the `constructfrom` pattern when deserializing automatically.
